meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unchanging or constant.
meanings.sent1: The invariabilities of the night sky bring a sense of peace and stability.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the invariabilities of certain natural phenomena to understand their patterns.
meanings.sent3: The invariabilities of the clock's ticking can be oddly comforting during a storm.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was as steady and unwavering as the invariabilities of the mountains.
meanings.sent5: The invariabilities of the seasons remind us of the passage of time.

meanings.definition: Things that do not vary or change.
meanings.sent1: In the world of mathematics, constants are considered invariabilities.
meanings.sent2: The invariabilities of the laws of physics govern the universe.
meanings.sent3: The invariabilities of his routine made him predictable but reliable.
meanings.sent4: Her commitment to her principles was as firm as the invariabilities of the North Star.
meanings.sent5: The invariabilities of the recipe ensure consistent results every time.
